name: HIV_B
title: HIV.B HTS visit  CodeSystem
description: CodeSystem for HIV.B HTS visit  Data Elements

concept.definition: Reason for HIV testing services visit
First encounter for screening for human immunodeficiency virus
Retesting for human immunodeficiency virus
Client attending facility for HIV testing services visit
Client reported coming to the facility after receiving a provider-assisted referral or patient referral from a contact or partner

concept.display: Partner or contact of an index case
concept.definition: The client is a contact or partner of a person diagnosed with HIV (an index case)

concept.display: Partner or contact of an HIV testing client (non-index case)
concept.definition: The client is a contact or partner identified through partner or social network services, but is not known to be a partner of an index-case

concept.display: Type of contact or partner for partner services
concept.definition: Client's relationship to the person that referred the client for partner services or family services
Client is the biological child of the person that referred the client for family services
Client is a drug-injecting partner of the person that referred the client for partner services
Client is a sexual partner of the person that referred the client for partner services
Client is a social contact of the person that referred the client for social-network services

concept.display: Contact with and (suspected) exposure to HIV
concept.definition: When the client is reported to have had suspected exposure to HIV

concept.display: Date/time of suspected exposure to HIV
concept.definition: Date and time when the client had suspected exposure to HIV
Whether testing is happening in the community or at a facility
Testing is happening in the community, which includes mobile testing
Where the testing is happening â€“ at a facility
Specific point in the community where testing is happening

concept.display: Mobile testing (e.g. through vans or temporary testing facilities)
concept.definition: The client tested through mobile testing, such as through vans or temporary testing facilities

concept.display: Voluntary counselling and testing centres (not within a health facility setting)
concept.definition: The client tested at a voluntary counselling and testing centre (not in a health facility setting)
The client tested through another type of community-based testing
Specific point where testing is happening at a facility

concept.display: Provider-initiated tested in a clinic or emergency facility
concept.definition: The client tested though provider-initiated HIV testing & counselling, which could be at an emergency facility
The client tested at an antenatal care clinic, including labour and delivery

concept.display: Voluntary counselling and testing (within a health facility setting)
concept.definition: The client tested through voluntary counselling and testing (within a health facility setting)
The client tested at a family planning clinic
The client tested at another type of facility
The client tested at a TB clinic

Gestational age in weeks and/or days depending on the source of gestational age

The HIV status of the client's partner.
Client's partner is HIV-positive
Client's partner is HIV-negative
Don't know HIV status - client does not know partner's HIV status

concept.display: Partner is from a key population*
concept.definition: Client's partner is a member of a key population, that has an increased risk of HIV
Client's partner is a sex worker

concept.display: Men who have sex with men
concept.definition: Client's partner is a man who has sex with men
Client's partner is transgender
Client's partner is a person who injects drugs

concept.display: People living in prisons and other closed settings
concept.definition: Client's partner lives in a prison or other closed setting

concept.display: Site where positive HIV test confirmed
concept.definition: Name or identifier of health facility where HIV test was confirmed
Probable route(s) of transmission of HIV to client
Probable route of HIV transmission was through heterosexual sex
Probable route of HIV transmission was through sex between men
Probable route of HIV transmission was through unprotected intercourse during sex work

concept.display: Injecting drug use with unsterile equipment
concept.definition: Probable route of HIV transmission was through injecting drug use with unsterile equipment
Probable route of HIV transmission was nosocomial
Probable route of HIV transmission to an infant was during pregnancy, labour, delivery and breastfeeding (vertical transmission)
Probable route of HIV transmission was other and may include needle accidents, blood transfusion, blood products or organ/tissue donations, tattoos, piercings, circumcision, or acupuncture.
If the client does not know the HIV status of the client's partner(s), offer to test and add results here

ART and virally suppression status of a partner of the client
Whether counselling was provided to a client during the visit
Whether counselling was provided to a client who has been diagnosed with HIV
Whether counselling was provided to a client who has been diagnosed with hepatitis B
Whether counselling was provided to a client who has been diagnosed with hepatitis C

concept.display: Syphilis counselling, treatment and further testing
concept.definition: Whether counselling and treatment was provided to a client who has been diagnosed with syphilis. Additional testing (RPR test) recommended.

concept.display: Linked to enrolment in care and ART initiation
concept.definition: Linkage made from HIV testing to enrolment in care following an HIV diagnosis
Whether counselling for voluntary medical male circumcision (VMMC) was provided following an HIV-negative test
Offer or refer to prevention services

concept.display: Offer male and female condoms and condom-compatible lubricants
concept.definition: Offer male and female condoms and condom-compatible lubricants

concept.display: Offer pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) for people at elevated risk for HIV acquisition
concept.definition: Offer pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) to people with substantial ongoing risk of HIV infection

concept.display: Offer post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) following suspected exposure
concept.definition: Offer or refer client for PEP following suspected exposure
Offer referral for VMMC services

concept.display: Harm reduction for people who inject drugs
concept.definition: Offer or refer to harm reduction services for people who inject drugs (needle and syringe programmes, opioid substitution therapy, other drug-dependence treatment and opioid overdose prevention and management)

concept.display: Behavioural interventions to support risk reduction, particularly for people with HIV and members of key populations
concept.definition: Offer or refer to behavioural interventions to support risk reduction, particularly for people with HIV and members of key populations

concept.display: HIV testing for partners and biological children
concept.definition: Offer voluntary testing for all partners and biological children of positive cases (includes partner services and index case testing), as welll as partners and social contacts of people from key populations, where appropriate

concept.display: HIV testing for partners and social contacts of people from key populations, where appropriate
concept.definition: Offer voluntary testing for partners and social contacts of people from key populations, where appropriate

concept.display: Sexual and reproductive health integrated services
concept.definition: Offer or refer to sexual and reproductive health services
Offer contraception and family planning services
Check women's pregnancy status
Offer services for prevention of mother-to-child transmission (counselling)

concept.display: Cervical cancer screening and treatment counselling
concept.definition: Offer cervical cancer screening and treatment counselling and services

concept.display: Anal cancer screening (for men who have sex with men)
concept.definition: Offer services for anal cancer screening (for men who have sex with men)
Offer sexually transmitted infection (STI) testing and treatment services
Other clinical services offered or referrals given to the client
Assessment and provision of vaccinations, such as for people from key populations, pregnant women and infants; and, where appropriate, tetanus vaccination for adolescent boys and men receiving VMMC

concept.display: Hepatitis B (HBV) and hepatitis C virus (HCV) testing and treatment provided
concept.definition: Offer or refer for HBV and/or HCV testing and treatment

concept.display: Co-trimoxazole chemoprophylaxis to prevent Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia provided
concept.definition: Offer or refer for co-trimoxazole chemoprophylaxis to prevent pneumocystis carinii pneumonia

concept.display: Intensified TB case finding and linkage to TB treatment provided
concept.definition: Offer or refer for intensified TB case finding and linkage to TB treatment

concept.display: Provision of isoniazid preventive therapy if person does not have TB
concept.definition: Offer or refer for provision of isoniazid preventive therapy if person does not have TB

concept.display: Malaria prevention (such as bed nets and prophylaxis), depending on epidemiology
concept.definition: Offer or refer for malaria prevention (such as bed nets and prophylaxis), depending on epidemiology
Offer or refer for other support services
Offer or refer for mental health services

concept.display: Psychosocial counselling, support and treatment adherence counselling
concept.definition: Offer or refer for psychosocial counselling, support and treatment adherence counselling

concept.display: Support for disclosure and partner services
concept.definition: Offer or refer for support for disclosure and partner services
Offer or refer for legal and social services

concept.display: Services for responding to violence against women
concept.definition: Offer or refer for services for responding to violence against women, including first-line support and psychosocial support, post-rape care and other support services including shelters, legal services and women and child protection services

concept.display: Clinical enquiry for intimate partner violence (IPV) done
concept.definition: Whether a clinical enquiry for intimate partner violence was conducted
Result of medical inquiry for intimate partner violence

Client was referred to another provider/facility
No additional action was deemed necessary
